PhotonHelper Class Reference

This Class is a helper class for the MINUIT minimization implementation. Its function is to calculate the fit energy and uncertainty for the photon from the values generated by the X^2 minimization in MINUIT. More...

#include <PhotonHelper.h>

Detailed Description

This Class is a helper class for the MINUIT minimization implementation. Its function is to calculate the fit energy and uncertainty for the photon from the values generated by the X^2 minimization in MINUIT.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PhotonHelper::PhotonHelper ( vectorFactory::ParticleParameters *  event  ) 

Constructor that takes in the smeared event and stores it locally for use in fit calculations

Member Function Documentation

double PhotonHelper::getPartialX1 ( double  x1,
double  x2 
) [private]

Function that assists in calculating the uncertainty on the fit energy. Computes the partial derivative of the energy fit equation (with mass constraint) with respect to x1.

Parameters:
x1 the curvature of the positron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
x2 the curvature of the electron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
Returns:
the partial derivative with respect to x1, evaluated with x1 and x2

double PhotonHelper::getPartialX2 ( double  x1,
double  x2 
) [private]

Function that assist in calculating the uncertainty on the fit energy. Computes the parital derivative of the energy fit equation (with mass constaraint) with respect to x2.

Parameters:
x1 the curvature of the positron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
x2 the curvature of the electron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
Returns:
the partial derivative with respect to x2, evaluated with x1 and x2

double PhotonHelper::getX3Fit ( double  x1,
double  x2 
)

Function that passes through the minimum x1 and x2 curvatures values for positron and electron to a copy the DalitzChiSq class which calculates the constrained energy for the photon */.

Parameters:
x1 the curvature of the positron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
x2 the curvature of the electron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
Returns:
The fit energy for the photon based on the X^2 minimization

double PhotonHelper::getX3Variance ( double  x1,
double  x2,
double  x1Variance,
double  x2Variance,
double  x12covariance 
)

Function that uses paramaters of the Covariance matrix in Numerical Minimization to compute the uncertainty on the fitted energy for the photon.

Parameters:
x1 the curvature of the positron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
x2 the curvature of the electron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization
x1Variance the variance of the positron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization, retrieved from the covariance matrix
x2Variance the variance of the electron from the X^2 Numerical Minimization, retrieved from the covariance matrix
x12Variance the covariance of the electron and positron curvatures from the X^2 Numerical Minimization, retrieved from the covariance matrix and is less than 0 because the curvatures are anticorrelated
Returns:
The variance on the photon energy

Member Data Documentation

vectorFactory::ParticleParameters* PhotonHelper::evtP

Local copy of the smeared event, should be populated from the minimization implementation and is the same smeared event from the minimization that is read by MinHelper

double PhotonHelper::M [private]

The mass of the pion

double PhotonHelper::m_e [private]

The mass of the electron/positron
